Sentencas: Incorporation of nanoparticles into devices such as solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) may provide benefits such as higher surface areas or finer control over microstructure.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, their use with traditional fabrication techniques such as screen-printing is problematic.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here, we show that mixing larger commercial particles with nanoparticles allows traditional ink formulation and screen-printing to be used while still providing benefits of nanoparticles such as increased porosity and lower sintering temperatures.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: SOFC anodes were produced by impregnating ceria-gadolinia (CGO) scaffolds with nickel nitrate solution.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The scaffolds were produced from inks containing a mixture of hydrothermally-synthesised nanoparticle CGO, commercial CGO and polymeric pore formers.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The scaffolds were heat-treated at either 1000 or 1300 degrees C, and were mechanically stable.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In situ ultra-small X-ray scattering (USAXS) shows that the nanoparticles begin sintering around 900-1000 degrees C. Analysis by USAXS and scanning electron microscopy (SEM) revealed that the low temperature heat-treated scaffolds possessed higher porosity.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Impregnated scaffolds were used to produce symmetrical cells, with the lower temperature heat-treated scaffolds showing improved gas diffusion, but poorer charge transfer.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Using these scaffolds, lower temperature heat-treated cells of Ni-CGO/200 mu m YSZ/CGO-LSCF performed better at 700 degrees C (and below) in hydrogen, and performed better at all temperatures using syngas, with power densities of up to 0.15 W cm(-2) at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This approach has the potential to allow the use of a wider range of materials and finer control over microstructure.
Titulo: Nanoparticle scaffolds for syngas-fed solid oxide fuel cells
